[LIST_ITEM] Splicing to make continuous mRNA w/ LVJC

[LIST_ITEM] 50 V X 30 D X 6 JH = 9000 heavy variable chains

[LIST_ITEM] Generated during V(D)J joining by variation in exact point of recombination
[LIST_ITEM] RAGs cut off recombination sequences and ligates them to release them
[LIST_ITEM] Exonuclease cuts off nucleotides and releases coding sequences to be ligated together
[LIST_ITEM] Same number of codons but a different sequence

[LIST_ITEM] Addition of nucleotides by terminal deoxynucleotide transferase to V, D, or J ends
[LIST_ITEM] When in B cell differentiation do Ig gene rearrangements take place?
[LIST_ITEM] In pro B cells, D is rearranged to a heavy chain J segment on both chromosomes at random
[LIST_ITEM] Heavy chain V region is rearranged to DJ on one chromosome
[LIST_ITEM] If out of frame/pseudogene, tries on other chromosome
[LIST_ITEM] If it fails again, B cell stops development
[LIST_ITEM] If μ heavy chain is expressed, becomes a pre B cell and also attempts light chain V-J rearrangement
[LIST_ITEM] Since there are four loci that could undergo VJ rearrangement, this step is usually successful
[LIST_ITEM] There are also several VJ rearrangements possible w/in a single locus
[LIST_ITEM] If light chain is produced and IgM goes to cell surface, immature B cell
[LIST_ITEM] If light chain is expressed, VL-JL joining shut off
[LIST_ITEM] Feed-back regulation is basis of allelic exclusion
[LIST_ITEM] Prevents expression of two heavy chains or two light chains
[LIST_ITEM] How does B cell switch from membrane bound IgM to secreted form?
[LIST_ITEM] Secreted μ has 20 aa sequence after C region
[LIST_ITEM] Membrane bound has 41 aa after C region
[LIST_ITEM] This sequence has n-terminal negative AA, then 26 uncharged aa (α helix) then positive charges at the C-term
[LIST_ITEM] This makes it stick in the membrane
[LIST_ITEM] MC region in btwn the two
[LIST_ITEM] After those two poly(A) sites, Cδ genes then another poly(A) region
[LIST_ITEM] If transcription continues to this point, mainly IgD expressed
